result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn C. Ably was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicles T&R in defts name, as is deft himself

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Defendant may transfer jail time and probation to serve in Brown County.

timeConds.notes: with huber for work/treatment if deft found eligible.  To begin within 45 days at discretion of PO.   1 day credit IF REVOKED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:29pm
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person and with Atty Paul Goetz.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW


PLEA:
Ct. 1 (PAC 4th)>> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 1 year probation.
CONDITIONS: $1959 inclusive (No DNA surcharge as not mandatory); 60 days MCJ w/huber for work and treatment if defendant found eligible under jail classification system, to begin within 45 days at the discretion of PO; 26 month DL Rev w/credit; AODA; Absolute sobriety; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 26 months;  $50 IID surcharge to be paid.

>>Defendant may transfer jail time or probation to serve in Brown County.
>>If revoked, defendant has one day credit for time served.

Case called: 10:25am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher; Defendant does not appear - Atty Amanda Ley appear on his behalf.

Atty Ley states matter was set just a day or two ago, and she has not been able to contact defendant to appear by phone.  State suggests matter can proceed w/out defendant.
COURT directs matter to be rescheduled and defendant must appear either in person or by phone.

RECALLED: 10:30am - Defendant now appears by phone; Same appearances

Atty Ley notes Motion to Withdraw has been filed - COURT notes Atty Ley appointed to case since 6/22/15, and Atty Ley agrees.
Atty Ley notes Motion to Suppress has already been ruled upon as well.
COURT notes history of case -- COURT does not allow withdrawal at this time; COURT questions defendant regarding counsel - Defendant states he is firing Atty Ley.
COURT advises defendant that he will be appointed new counsel by PDs office but will likely be the last appointment.

COURT directs matter to be reset as defendant has dismissed Atty Ley -- matter to be reset for PTC in 10 days and trial to be reset.
Bond continues.
